title: How to Make Candy Corn Fudge

steps.headline: Prepare the loaf pan.
steps.description: Neatly line a 9-inch loaf pan with parchment paper, letting the paper edges hang over the sides.

steps.headline: Mix the chocolate chips, cream, and honey.
steps.description: In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the white chocolate chips, heavy whipping cream, and honey using a wooden spoon. Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Microwave the chocolate mixture.
steps.description: Place the bowl in the microwave for about 30 seconds. After microwaving, stir slowly using a spoon until the chocolate is melted and smooth.

steps.headline: Add the yellow food coloring.
steps.description: Add 10-15 drops of yellow food coloring into the white chocolate mixture. Stir with the spoon until the color is a vibrant bright yellow.

steps.headline: Pour the yellow mixture in the loaf pan.
steps.description: Using a rubber spatula, scrape out the yellow chocolate into the loaf pan. Spread it all around with the rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Chill the layer.
steps.description: Place the loaf pan in the fridge to chill. Have the white chocolate layer chill for about 30 minutes, until it slightly hardens.

steps.headline: Add the orange food coloring.
steps.description: Add 10-15 drops of orange food coloring into the white chocolate mixture. Stir with the spoon until the color resembles a bright, vibrant orange.

steps.headline: Pour the orange mixture in the loaf pan.
steps.description: Using a rubber spatula, scrape out the orange chocolate into the loaf pan. Spread it all around with the rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Chill the layer.
steps.description: Place the loaf pan in the fridge to chill. Have the white chocolate layer chill for about 30 minutes, until it slightly hardens.

steps.headline: Mix the white chocolate chips, cream, and honey.
steps.description: In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the white chocolate chips, heavy whipping cream, and honey using a wooden spoon. Mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Microwave the chocolate mixture.
steps.description: Place the bowl in the microwave for about 30 seconds. After microwaving, stir slowly using a spoon until the chocolate is melted and smooth.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla.
steps.description: Pour the vanilla extract into the white chocolate mixture. Stir slowly with a spoon.

steps.headline: Pour the white mixture in the loaf pan.
steps.description: Using a rubber spatula, scrape out the white chocolate into the loaf pan. Spread it all around with the rubber spatula, finishing up the layer.

steps.headline: Chill the layer.
steps.description: Place the loaf pan in the fridge to chill. Have the fudge chill for about two hours, until it hardens firmly and the layers are thick.

steps.headline: Slice the fudge into candy corn pieces.
steps.description: Using a thin cutting knife, slice the fudge into triangular pieces that resemble candy corn.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Place the fudge into a serving bowl. Serve with a glass of milk, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Making the Yellow Layer Prepare the loaf pan. Neatly line a 9-inch loaf pan with parchment paper, letting the paper edges hang over the sides. Mix the chocolate chips, cream, and honey. In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the white chocolate chips, heavy whipping cream, and honey using a wooden spoon. Mix until well-combined. Microwave the chocolate mixture. Place the bowl in the microwave for about 30 seconds. After microwaving, stir slowly using a spoon until the chocolate is melted and smooth. Add the yellow food coloring. Add 10-15 drops of yellow food coloring into the white chocolate mixture. Stir with the spoon until the color is a vibrant bright yellow. Pour the yellow mixture in the loaf pan. Using a rubber spatula, scrape out the yellow chocolate into the loaf pan. Spread it all around with the rubber spatula. Chill the layer. Place the loaf pan in the fridge to chill. Have the white chocolate layer chill for about 30 minutes, until it slightly hardens. Making the Orange Layer Mix the white chocolate chips, cream, and honey. In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the white chocolate chips, heavy whipping cream, and honey using a wooden spoon. Mix until well-combined. Microwave the chocolate mixture. Place the bowl in the microwave for about 30 seconds. After microwaving, stir slowly using a spoon until the chocolate is melted and smooth. Add the orange food coloring. Add 10-15 drops of orange food coloring into the white chocolate mixture. Stir with the spoon until the color resembles a bright, vibrant orange. Pour the orange mixture in the loaf pan. Using a rubber spatula, scrape out the orange chocolate into the loaf pan. Spread it all around with the rubber spatula. Chill the layer. Place the loaf pan in the fridge to chill. Have the white chocolate layer chill for about 30 minutes, until it slightly hardens. Finishing the Fudge Mix the white chocolate chips, cream, and honey. In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the white chocolate chips, heavy whipping cream, and honey using a wooden spoon. Mix until well-combined. Microwave the chocolate mixture. Place the bowl in the microwave for about 30 seconds. After microwaving, stir slowly using a spoon until the chocolate is melted and smooth. Add the vanilla. Pour the vanilla extract into the white chocolate mixture. Stir slowly with a spoon. Pour the white mixture in the loaf pan. Using a rubber spatula, scrape out the white chocolate into the loaf pan. Spread it all around with the rubber spatula, finishing up the layer. Chill the layer. Place the loaf pan in the fridge to chill. Have the fudge chill for about two hours, until it hardens firmly and the layers are thick. Slice the fudge into candy corn pieces. Using a thin cutting knife, slice the fudge into triangular pieces that resemble candy corn. Serve and enjoy! Place the fudge into a serving bowl. Serve with a glass of milk, if desired. Enjoy!
